main event: Three white objects were observed near Regina, Canada, Opheim, Montana, and Fortuna, North Dakota, for approximately 1 hour on May 7, 1960.
interesting points: The objects started over the Regina Airport, went north, then stopped, proceeded east and stopped, before fading away.
The objects were tracked on ground radar at various locations, including the FPS-20 and FPS-6A radar systems.
An F-121E fighter jet was scrambled to intercept the objects, but was unable to visually locate them or pick them up on airborne radar.
The movement of the objects was correlated with the release of a weather balloon in the area, and the objects were concluded to likely be the weather balloon reflecting northern lights.
Strong northern lights were reported by the pilot who scrambled to intercept the objects.
result: Likely a weather balloon reflecting northern lights
location: Regina, Canada; Opheim, Montana; Fortuna, North Dakota
